items.title: Duolingo Clone
items.description: I developed this website to help teach myself modern coding practices and technologies. It features familiar functionalities where users can choose a language course, and have guided lessons with beautiful design, characters, audio & visual effects.

items.title: Study Spaces Web Application
items.description: During my Computer Science capstone at Liberty University, I collaborated on an agile team to develop a full-stack, production-level web application. The app helps users find and join local study groups. My role focused on designing the user experience and connecting the React front-end to the Node.js back-end, where I contributed to creating a REST API.

items.title: Kyxa WebSockets API
items.description: Kyxa is a unique online multiplayer game that I helped to develop in collaboration with a friend. My main responsibility was focused on creating a complete Websocket API server to establish real-time multiplayer communication, as well as designing and developing multiple algorithms to manipulate data structures in serving WebSocket requests.

items.title: Wildflower Hope
items.description: This blog was voluntarily developed using Wordpress for a non-profit organization. It features a custom, modern design; email marketing integration; and many other features that showcase my ability with front-end architecture as well as utilizing the Wordpress CMS

items.title: Social Media Application
items.description: Aï»¿ full stack web application that offers full user authentication and gives users the ability to post, like and comment on content in a modern user interface.

items.title: Twenty-Forty-Eight Game
items.description: With the collaboration of an agile-based team, I was able to lead the development of a game resembling the popular 2048 tile matching game with several features added, such as the ability to set the layout of the board.
